dublin_core.dcvalue: ETAT is a mobile phone based triage system used in urban health centers by Health Surveillance Assistants that allows them to scan through the queues to identify children needing immediate medical assessment. The tool tracks a child from assessment in the queue to arrival at the hospital.
Steve Ollis, D-tree International, Email: sollis@d-tree.org | Thomasena O'Byrne, Action Meningitis, Email: tobyrne@mlw.medcol.mw
Action Meningitis (an initiative of the Meningitis Research Foundation principally funded by the Scottish Government and Deutsche Bank)
Electronic Decision Support, Sensors and point-of-care diagnostics, Infectious Diseases
